roleset.name: get

example.name: typically passive
example.text: Financing plans include raising $170 million in debt-1 secured *trace*-1 by the company's holdings in New Jersey.
example.arg: by the company 's holdings in New Jersey

example.name: with source
example.text: McCaw said it has secured commitments from three banks to help finance its $125-a-share bid for 22 million of Lin's shares.
example.arg: [ commitments ] [ to help finance its $125-a-share bid for 22 million of Lin's shares]

roleset.note: Frames file for 'secure' based on financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. Member of Vncls get-13.5.1-1.

roleset.name: make secure, literally or figuratively

example.name: poor John
example.text: John secured his place in the Hall of Shame with his lousy dissertation.
example.arg: his place in the Hall of Shame

roleset.note: Adjectival 'secure' based on BOLT-2,3. Member of VNcls ensure-99, shake-22.3-2-1.

example.name: adjectival rel: secure
example.text: You would think that having 4 part time jobs that at least you will have 2 at any one time and that is more secure than having 1 full time job and possibly being given notice to leave .
example.arg: [more][than having 1 full time job and possibly being given notice to leave]
